name: 3.19 "Behind Every Great Man" Quiz / Test | 'Cheers'- Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Sam do in the beginning of the show?
questions.explanation:
Changed the keg.

	This was a big event at Cheers. Everyone was lined up on two sides for Sam to walk through with the keg.

Norm.

	Norm really loved his beer and got emotional at the changing of the keg. He told Cliff, "I swore this time it wouldn't get to me."

Cary Grant.

	Cliff bragged about his luck with women. However, when a beautiful woman came over and talks to him all he can do is babble.

questions.text: Why did the reporter end the interview with Sam?
questions.correct: He kept on hitting on her.
options: He had to return to work.
He was so good looking he couldn't concentrate on it.
questions.explanation:
He kept on hitting on her.

	Sam said that he wasn't really hitting on her. He said he was showing her the come ons he had heard working in the bar.

questions.text: Who did Sam quote to impress Paula?
questions.explanation:
Diane Chambers.

	He quoted her about single people going to single bars to get Paula to stay. He then took Paula out to dinner to discuss the singles scene some more.

questions.correct: Using Diane's brain to get another woman's body
options: That he's an alcoholic and owns a bar
That he's a baseball player and hates sports
Using Cliff's brain to impress other men
questions.explanation:
Using Diane's brain to get another woman's body.

	He started asking Diane questions about impressionists. He also had a book he could study for, but felt it was easier to ask Diane than to study himself.

True.

	Sam in the past had been interested in Diane. In the previous season they were dating. However, in this episode Diane is with Frasier and Sam wanted to go out with Paula.

questions.text: What did Sam want Diane to do?
questions.explanation:
watch the bar.

	This was a hilarious scene where Diane thinks she's being asked to go away with him for the weekend. Sam is however talking about watching the bar, at one point he said, "I think things will go a lot better now that you know where everything is."

questions.text: Who did Diane say the suitcase belonged to?
questions.explanation:
Al.

	Al was played by Al Rosen. He died in 1990 at age 80 from cancer.

questions.text: When was the last time the man had so much fun?
questions.explanation:
1958.

	Al was an old man who was a recurring character on "Cheers". He often made hints that he was a ladies man.
